reviews.sentence: Great room. Beautiful hotel. Had a problem with the hot water but the maintenance department tried to resolve it. Time was a factor so we had to leave before it was taken care if.

A massive disapointment. Location was good to see the sites. We arrived to be told that the pool was closed down for maintenance and we could use one at another hotel down the road breakfast was a very poor quality cold dry and not at all tasteful. There are a lot of hidden parking charges etc.

Great business hotel not so much for a romantic getaway. Visited the JW for our anniversary a Tuesday through a Sunday and chose this hotel because of the pool and proximity to the quarter and business district. We had a corner room executive king room which faced towards the business district on the 23rd floor. PARKING. Parking was nightmare. We could n’t even pull up to the hotel to drop off our bags as the loading zone was full of vans. We double parked so I could ask where to park since we tried calling and the line would not go through. The young valet attendant said to park elsewhere and was not at all helpful. POOL. The pool area is much smaller than pictures make if seem. It ’s a very hip area but was full and so where to sit and there are limited lounge chairs. We also were kicked out for trying to bring a couple of drinks out with us as they have a small portable bar that they want you to buy from. I did n’t know there was this option as there is no information on the hotel website about it. We had hard cider as i am gluten intolerant and they did not serve hard cider so we had our drinks in the tiny lobby instead. It was n’t at all what we were shooting ambience wise. The Roosevelt or the Hilton river front have a much better pool area and vibe. The pool was the main reason we booked at this hotel and we never got to use it. Huge disapointment. LOBBY AND CHECK IN. Lobby is so small and lacking a wow factor. There also were at least 6 10 employees gathered near the door. It ’s nice to see they have enough staff. Lobby had fruit flavored water most of the time. I recommend using the ap to check in ahead of time. Check in staff was very friendly and professional. ROOM. The room was clean and fresh but definitely reminded me of my grandma ’s house with the green carpet and beige on beige décor. The corner executive suite was no where near as nice as the Roosevelt or Hilton but was just “ nice ”. The bed was a bit too soft for my preference but my husband liked it. The bathrom vanity was in a galley style format LOCATION NOLA is not new to us but we still wanted to be near the quarter but spent a lot of time in the business district which offers the same feel as the quarter but cheaper and less crowded. This hotel is perfectly located for both and has two streetcar options right outside of the hotel which will take you to the garden district. Jackson square is about a 10 minute walk from the JW. STAFF. All of my encounters with staff were very professional and positive. Staff were all polite and treated us as though we were their 1 priority this was not the case at all at the Roosevelt. I appreciate the JW level of customer service. Management should know what a great job they are doing. Concierge also sent us complimentary champagne and strawberries for our anniversary. That was a very nice touch. OTHER They are doing maintenance on the elevators so there are only a couple in use so it took forever to get up and down. It seemed like most of the hotel guests were young hipsters or convention goers. I did n’t see anyone that looked like they were there for a romantic holiday like we were hence we never felt like we wanted to stay at the hotel since the pool and lobby were duds. The Roosevelt is definitely the best option for romantic ambience. TIPS. CVS is right around the corner from the JW and has a great selection of drinks and snacks that can easily be brought back to the room. Daisy Dukes is open 24 hours and is across the street as well and has killer deals of really good po boys and breakfast 5 breakfast.

Very nice. My husband and I stayed at this hotel in July during Essence Festival. The hotel was very nice clean quiet and in a great location. Our only complaint while staying there was that our refrigerator stopped working on the 2nd or 3rd day and we called twice to have it repaired or replaced and no one ever came. I understand that the hotel was very busy during this time but it was disappointing that it was never taken care of during our 5night stay. Other than that we had no issues had an amazing time.

Average Experience in NO. The CW is for business and conventions. Lots or restoration and updates being done at this time. Elevators were slow because of repairs. Not a luxury hotel and one should not expect pampering. Rooms were satisfactory. Clean sheets and towels. Bed was average comfort. Centrally located down town. Starbucks right next store.

A little disappointed. We booked this hotel for the week before the actual Mardi Gras Fat Tuesday. We stayed here for same period last year also. I think possibly the rooms are getting a little dated or just lack proper service. Our TV needed the technician to come to fix it as did our neighbors. Once I saw the reset button on the back needed to be reset I became my own technician. The A C did not work properly and could not cool the room. Technician came and fixed it right away as we were leaving to take a walking tour. We returned late in the evening and found the room had really cooled to be now actually cold so we moved the thermostatFrom 65 to 70 ° and went to bed. The next morning A C was still going and room just as cold. This time we shut it off and left for another walking tour. We returned later that day and found that you could not adjust the temps or shut the A C off. We passed this info on to the tech who came to fix the TV but we are leaving next day so I have no idea if it was ever repaired correctly. The service at the Mariot was superb as we have come to expect. The lounge is now on ground level instead of 28th floor. It was as expected well maintained with a very courteous staff. The hotel is obvious under renovation as signs are up regarding elevators being updated. This hotel is located where nearly all activities are walkable. We will return to this mystic city next year for Mardi Gras but not sure we will stay here. I am not saying you should not but there are so many fine hotels that we might try another.

Tired and Worn Down. I was disappointed in the room compared to other JW Mariots I have stayed at. We arrived and 3 bellmen were standing outside and did not help us get our luggage out of the taxi. The room was small very worn and needs to be updated and it smelled overwhelmingly like skunk weed. There was no fan in the bathroom so everything was damp and the bathtub did not drain so I had to take a shower standing in 2 3 inches of water. The only positive worth mentioning was that the housekeeping staff was very nice and brought us extra towels and tissues since ours were damp. Overall I would not recommend this hotel until they update the property.

Mixed feelings. We arrived and the staff was very pleasant. Upon check in they charged our credit card twice. It took a little time to clear it up. we had requested early check in which they said was at 1 pm however our room was not ready. Fast forward to the first night stay our cold water was warm. I did not think it was a big deal but they were notified and they said they would send someone to look into it. The following day the water was even warmer. We again complained and was told it had be repaired that day. So we go out all day and come back in around midnight. We all needed a shower and the cold water was so hot it was steaming. Contacted them and finally someone came at midnight and fixed it. It was a little annoying after a long day and after complaining about it three times. They are doing some construction on the building so we could hear a jackhammer. But anyway all around the staff was nice room was clean.

We are currently staying at the hotel and the upper levels are under renovation. So do nt even think about trying to sleep in late or have an afternoon nap. It sounds like a jack hammer is coming thru the ceiling. it is ridiculous. We were not made aware that the hotel would be under renovations when booking or we would have stayed elsewhere. I would highly recommend staying at another hotel until renovations are complete unles you enjoy the constant noise of construction. Highly disappointed in JW Mariot. Also I forgot to mention our sink was broken upon arrival and a lamp kept flashing when turned off.
Room was recently renovated stay was great.

central hotel with good facilities. This hotel has been recently refurbished has good rooms with a pleasant decor and good room space. The bed is comfortable. The bathroom is small and there was 0only a shower but not bath. The room wall are very thin so noise from surrounding rooms is problematic at night.
Great recently remodeled hotel that is in a good location. The best hotel gym I have used.
Updated renovations were amazing. Hotel was in a great location near by all resturants bars and shopping.

Stayed here for a two day business meeting. The front desk staff was courteous and eager to please. The renovations to the rooms were expertly done so that the entire hotel seems brand new. I plan to return in a year and am looking forward to my next stay.
Newly remodeled comfy beds and pillows great customer service. Perfect location for walking to all the sites French Quarter Bourbon Street French Market and viewing the Parades. We enjoyed our stay.

Wonderful hotel in a great location. Wonderful renovated hotel in walking distance of all the big attractions in NOLAThe room was very clean and quite and the staff was attentive to everything I needed. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting and wanting to stay in and around the French quarter.

Upscale on Canal. Emergency detour to this hotel after a fire at my original destination. Hotel staff was very accommodating to my group on very short notice even providing a courtesy breakfast. The hotel was updated nice rooms and public areas. Staff very helpful and polite. Great location just outside the French Quarter close to the action but quiet.

The rooms were recently renovated with a modern touch. Staff were very friendly. The newly renovated rooms seemed to have less sound isolation. I could hear muffled conversation from my neighbors clear hallway conversation pool parties 8 floors below and street noise 16 floors below. Being in the French Quarters the noise is a bit expected Mariot could have done a bit more to acomodation business travelers andor light sleepers. Although I did nt have any issues with my HVAC a couple of my colleagues had issues with the A C holding the temperature both high and low.
